utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Tell him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y'know he's the botanist.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hmm? Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It must take you forever to find your keys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. Is this actually a lunchbox?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, so can you make it on Friday?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich? Why don't you get a magician?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, he's really good looking. What am I gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings! Don't cry outloud.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway musical?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities. So I think I'm gonna sing New York, New York, and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mr. Dickens gets to pick 'em.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.content: I'll get you the Cliff Notes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The abridgment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, okay. The what?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: ...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Twenty percent.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!! I love this job! Wow! My first call.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Here, let me. Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi, is Rachel there?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: And who may I say is calling?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is Ross?

utterance.content: Ross of.....

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of Ross and Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Oh hi. It's, it's Mark.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh hey, hey Mark.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Hey, hold on a second.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi honey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, he's just goofing around.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in his own office?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two assistants.

utterance.content: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go. Mark, I need you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ow! Ross!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing another number.

utterance.speaker: Jeannine
utterance.content: All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please, I'm not going for anything.

utterance.speaker: Jeannine
utterance.content: Well, if you don't, I will.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Would you please go?

utterance.content: Look Julio, someone left their book here.

utterance.content: Oh yeah, what are you reading?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Have I read it? No, are you enjoying it?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: I thought I would, but the translation's no good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Your a poet and don't know it.

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: Actually I ah, I am a poet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, then you do know it. So um what kind of things do you write about?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mine? Right here?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: I can write an epic poem about this lip.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How would that go? Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, you've got to pick a pocket or two..........

utterance.content: Lovely, just lovely.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on Saturday.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Excellent, I'll be there.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.

utterance.content: Yeah, I can dance, y'know.

utterance.content: Oh no, no, no, no.

utterance.content: What, what is that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I have to get that, but no-no. Hello? Hi! Yeah listen, I'm, I'm in need of a stripper and I was told that you do that. Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred? So would I, would I have to provide the grapes?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.

utterance.content: Get out! I couldn't stop if a meteor hit me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier.

utterance.content: Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To yourself. Hey-hey-hey, y'know what that's pretty good.

utterance.content: Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work.

utterance.content: What, what, what?!

utterance.content: What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look, 'My vessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I've touched you, you seem emptier still.' He thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase!

utterance.content: You really think that is what he meant?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too.

utterance.content: Done.

utterance.content: Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?

utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm...

utterance.content: Wh-what's that?

utterance.content: It's from Ross, it's a love bug.

utterance.content: Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, no-no-no, that's not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's just really romantic.

utterance.content: Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: One, two, three...

utterance.content: Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It won't be long before your the boss.

utterance.content: Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah.

utterance.content: And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one and only boyfriend...

utterance.speaker: The Bass Barber
utterance.content: It's nice to have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Quartet
utterance.content: Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross!

utterance.content: I'm hurt! I'm actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you any of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right Ross!! I get it!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I mean my God...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're hurt!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...can't, can't a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend's office anymorrrrre!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your territory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I would never do that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, I know what's going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He said this is what you guys do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Mark's a genius!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to complain about you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What am I going to do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know you guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be like, 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He paints quite a picture doesn't he?

utterance.content: Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: And wait, I've got something for you.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Mark!!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: It's okay, Rachel knows.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Yeah, but even soo.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhh! That is soo sweet!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on no one's around, just, just kiss me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right that's, that's it!! Get off her!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: What is going on?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What's going on?! That's what's going on!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie! What do I have to do to get some service?! Hi Rach.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, does that mean the audition is off?

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.

utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.content: Oh-ho, look what I got Julio.

utterance.content: Yeah, it's a vase.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, just like the one in the poem.

utterance.content: Well not exactly like the one in the poem.

utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.content: Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You don't even know me...

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you would think this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe...

utterance.speaker: Julio
utterance.content: No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: All right, let's do it!

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: No, no, no. What was that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, it was the best I could get out of them.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Well, people!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: People, people, people.

utterance.content: Let's try it again, and this time let's watch everybody watch Joey. Show 'em how it's done. Count it off.

utterance.content: So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night?

utterance.content: And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street, she's window shopping, and whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked!

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.content: Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen.

utterance.content: I'm sorry, I was an idiot.

utterance.content: A big idiot.

utterance.content: A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda hard for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, why is it hard, I mean we've been together for almost a year now?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if it's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Let it be me! Let it be me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you pick me up some porn?

utterance.content: Where ya going?

utterance.content: Oh, I've got to go pick up Ben, we've got a play date this afternoon.

utterance.content: Ohh, with who?

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: You have a play date with a stripper?!

utterance.content: Man, I gotta get a kid.

utterance.content: Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y'know, did her thing. And it turns out she's got a boy about Ben's age, so we're taking them to a gym-boree class. Why, is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure, is she married?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ahh, no.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noo, I y'know I don't see why she has to play with you, that's all. I mean doesn't she have any y'know other stripper moms friends of her own?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are totally jealous.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain things y'know about strippers. And y'know, and um, I...

utterance.content: Ugh. Wait, wait, wait.

utterance.content: What?
